summary: Diff adds an assignment ID compatibility utility, normalizes React Query cache keys by assignment ID, and introduces a retry helper with console diagnostics. However, the diff excerpt is truncated before showing that all required recording operations are wrapped to perform the one-time retry on "Invalid assignment:" errors, and it does not clearly show the single user-facing error behavior when both attempts fail.

missing_requirements.requirement: When the backend returns an error containing "Invalid assignment:" for any recording operation (save, share, get, delete, getAssignmentRecordings, getParticipantRecording), the frontend retries the same request once using the alternate ID format, proceeds normally if retry succeeds, and shows a single English user-facing error if both attempts fail (no duplicate toasts/errors).
missing_requirements.reason: While a retry helper is introduced, the diff is truncated before showing the actual execution wrapper and its use across all listed recording operations, and no concrete UI error/toast de-duplication behavior is visible in the provided changes.
evidence: frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts (truncated; shows retry helper but not the full integration across operations)

missing_requirements.requirement: When an invalid-assignment error occurs, console logs indicate the original assignment ID, the fallback ID used for retry, and whether the retry succeeded, including a sanitized backend error message, without sensitive user data.
missing_requirements.reason: The shown logs include original/alternate IDs and success/failure, and sanitizeErrorMessage is logged on retry failure, but the excerpt does not show logging of the sanitized *original* backend error message at the moment the retry path is triggered (could be in truncated portion).
evidence: frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts (truncated; logging shown for retry attempt/success and retry failure with sanitizeErrorMessage, but original error logging not shown)
